title: Add contact details, remove Caffeine attribution, and enhance agency credibility content

requirements.text:
Add a dedicated Contact section that is reachable from the site navigation and includes the agency email and WhatsApp number.

Include these exact contact details in the Contact section:
- Email: dkoda911@gmail.com
- WhatsApp: +1 626-875-4603

The Contact section must be accessible via a “Contact” option in the header navigation and must scroll to the Contact section when clicked (consistent with existing smooth-scroll behavior).

quotes: Give our email dkoda911@gmail.com ... give our whatsApp no. 6268754603 add this in contact option

acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation includes a “Contact” item in both desktop and mobile menus.
Clicking “Contact” smoothly scrolls to a section with id="contact" (or equivalent) without routing changes.
The Contact section visibly displays the exact email “dkoda911@gmail.com” and WhatsApp number “+1 626-875-4603”.
Email is rendered as a mailto link and WhatsApp is rendered as a wa.me link (clickable).

requirements.text: Remove the “Built with … using caffeine.ai” attribution block from the site footer and ensure the footer layout remains visually balanced after removal.

quotes: remove build by caffeine ai at bottom

acceptanceCriteria: No footer text or link referencing “caffeine.ai” appears anywhere in the UI.
Footer still displays the copyright line and does not look visually broken on mobile or desktop.

requirements.text:
Improve the marketing site content so it feels more real, detailed, and impressive for an influencer marketing agency.

Update/extend the existing marketing sections to add more credibility-oriented content (keep all text in English), such as:
- A clearer services breakdown (for brands and for creators)
- A more detailed process/timeline (what happens after someone applies)
- Social proof placeholders (e.g., testimonial cards and/or “trusted by” logo placeholders) without claiming real brands or numbers
- An FAQ section addressing common questions for brands and creators

Do not remove the existing “How It Works”, “What We Offer”, or the application forms; enhance around them.

quotes: made it look real and more impressive and ad more details you think it should be in it as a agency website

acceptanceCriteria: The homepage includes at least one new credibility-oriented section (e.g., FAQ) in addition to the existing sections.
Added content does not include unverifiable claims (no real client logos, brand names, or performance numbers unless provided by the user).
All new user-facing copy is in English and matches the site’s existing tone.
Existing application forms remain present and functional.

requirements.text: Update the footer “Get in Touch” area to include the same agency email and WhatsApp contact details (dkoda911@gmail.com, +1 626-875-4603) so users can contact Koda D without needing to fill the application forms.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer contains clickable email (mailto) and WhatsApp (wa.me) links with the exact provided values.
Footer copy no longer implies that the only way to contact is via the application form.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
Use English for any user-facing text added or updated.
nonGoals: Adding third-party contact integrations (e.g., WhatsApp API automation, email sending services).
Adding real-time chat or messaging features.
Adding new backend storage or endpoints for contact messages (beyond existing lead forms).
